content.description: Climb the wall on the climber's left side of the alcove (the shorter wall). Variations are possible. Fun and easy.
content.protection: The landing is better than Hardy Har, but not flat.
content.location: Located on the left side of the alcove found on uphill Southeast side of Pirate Rocks.

climbs.name: Northwest Slabs of The Little Dome

content.description: Variations are possible on this small expanse of rock. For the most part it's 4th class. But you may encounter the occasional 5th class move or two, depending on the line you choose. This is a fun scramble to do when leaving the West side of The Little Dome and heading for Echo Canyon, The Backside, or the parking lot.
content.protection: None. There are no bolts, no anchors, and no opportunities for gear placements or natural pro.
content.location: Located on the Northwest side of The Little Dome to the skier's right of Pirate Rocks.

content.description: Hardy Har is found in the alcove on the Southwest side of Pirate Rocks. It is the obvious line of nice flat edges that ascend the tall face on the climber's right side of the alcove. Variations are possible and some are documented in guide books, but this seems like the most natural and inviting problem. Down climb boulder pile in the corner of the dihedral.
content.protection: Poor landing area, even with a pad. Don't fall. No bolts or anchors of any kind.
content.location: Hardy Har is found in the alcove on the Southwest side of Pirate Rocks.

content.description: The Pirate Rocks are a jumble of boulders situated on the Northwest side of the Little Dome. They are home to a couple of fun problems, a few variations, and potential for more. This is a remote area that is not often visited. It's worth checking out if you're crossing the Little Dome in route to another destination.
